The bottom panel uses `.recent-article-image` with a fixed `height: 200px`, which distorts images. Updating the CSS to use `aspect-ratio` instead of a fixed height.


---

---


Updating the CSS to use `aspect-ratio` instead of a fixed height for the bottom panel images:


---

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="search_replace">

<details><summary>Tool use: **code_edit** • Edit file: themes/majority/static/css/style.css</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 1, lines removed: 1

```diff
@@ -652,5 +652,5 @@
  .recent-article-image {
      width: 100%;
-     height: 200px;
+     aspect-ratio: 16 / 9;
      overflow: hidden;
      background: #e0e0e0;
```

</details>

</tool-use>

---



---


Updated the CSS to use `aspect-ratio: 16 / 9` instead of a fixed `height: 200px` for the bottom panel article images. This keeps a consistent 16:9 ratio across all images.

The change:
- Removed the fixed `height: 200px`
- Added `aspect-ratio: 16 / 9`

Images will maintain this ratio while `object-fit: cover` ensures they fill the container. Rebuild the site to see the update.

Trying a different approach: removing the fixed aspect ratio and letting images maintain their natural aspect ratio, with a max-height constraint:


---

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="search_replace">

<details><summary>Tool use: **code_edit** • Edit file: themes/majority/static/css/style.css</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 5, lines removed: 3

```diff
@@ -652,13 +652,15 @@
  .recent-article-image {
      width: 100%;
-     aspect-ratio: 16 / 9;
      overflow: hidden;
      background: #e0e0e0;
+     display: flex;
+     align-items: center;
+     justify-content: center;
  }
  
  .recent-article-image img {
      width: 100%;
-     height: 100%;
-     object-fit: cover;
+     height: auto;
+     display: block;
      transition: transform 0.3s;
  }
```

</details>

</tool-use>

The CSS is updated to 4:3. If it still looks the same, try:

1. Hard refresh your browser (Ctrl+F5 or Ctrl+Shift+R) to clear cache
2. If you're running a dev server, it should auto-rebuild

Which aspect ratio do you want?
- 4:3 (current)
- 3:2
- 1:1 (square)
- Natural (no fixed ratio)

Also, should images be cropped to fit (`object-fit: cover`) or shown fully without cropping (`object-fit: contain`)?

```diff
      width: 100%;
-     aspect-ratio: 4 / 3;
```

**Chunk 2**

```diff
@@ -659,6 +658,6 @@
  .recent-article-image img {
      width: 100%;
-     height: 100%;
```

---



---


Updated the CSS so images keep their natural aspect ratio. Changes:

- Removed the `aspect-ratio` constraint
- Changed `height: 100%` to `height: auto` on the images
- Added `display: block` to prevent inline spacing issues

Images in the bottom panel will now display at their natural proportions. If you're running a dev server, it should rebuild automatically. Otherwise, rebuild the site or hard refresh your browser (Ctrl+F5) to see the changes.
